subject: Re: [junit] Mock
msgSnippet: Slipped on the send button, sorry about the last post. Most people pick up mocks to test a system in isolation from external resources. I ve been more
messageBody:
Slipped on the send button, sorry about the last post.

Most people pick up mocks to test a system in isolation from external
resources. I've been more successful when using them to test classes in
isolation from other classes.

I also found that dynamic mock frameworks work very poorly when used
"test-after". I think of mocks mainly as a design-tool. If you're not
interested in the design-aid mocks provide then in my experience they will
provide very little value for you.

Just my opinion, not the rules :)
/J
